content.question: Beams of monochromatic light are emitted from two sources. Light from source <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has half the wavelength of light from source <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the energy <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of photons emitted by <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to the energy of photons emitted by <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and includes a correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub A equals 2 E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the energy of photons is inversely proportional to the wavelength of the light.

<math alttext="E sub A equals one half E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the energy of photons is proportional to the wavelength of the light.

<math alttext="E sub A equals E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the energy of photons, like the speed of light, is independent of their wavelength.

<math alttext="E sub A equals one quarter E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the energy of photons is inversely proportional to the square of the wavelength.

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub A equals 2 E sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Α</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Β</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the energy of photons is inversely proportional to the wavelength of the light.
